_id.description: The "_id" value: - MUST NOT change for the life of the node. - SHOULD be globally unique - SHOULD be generated by the app (ideally in default value closure... e.g. UuidIdentifier::generate())

creator_ref.description: A fully qualified reference to what created this node. This is intentionally a message-ref and not a user id because it is often a program that creates nodes, not a user.

updater_ref.description: A fully qualified reference to what updated this node. This is intentionally a message-ref and not a user id because it is often a program that updates nodes, not a user. E.g. "acme:iam:node:app:cli-scheduler" or "acme:iam:node:user:60c71df0-fda8-11e5-bfb9-30342d363854"

last_event_ref.description: A reference to the last event that changed the state of this node. E.g. "acme:blog:event:article-published:60c71df0-fda8-11e5-bfb9-30342d363854"

order_date.description: Determines the sequence that this teaser node will be rendered in lists, search results, etc. It DOES NOT control visibility or publishing. A date was used over an integer (e.g. seq_no) for blog-like, reverse chronological, clarity in sorting.

slotting.description: A map of integers, e.g. {home: 1, sports: 5, tv: 9}, that determine where teasers will render in lists that use slotting. We call it slotting vs sticky or pinning as that is generally just one at a time.

image_ref.description: A reference to the image asset to use for widgets, sharing, seo.

description.description: A description of the teaser (usually a few sentences). It should typically not have HTML as it is used in metadata, feeds, SERP and social.

caption.description: Text to be used to caption the teaser.

cta_text.description: Text to be used for the call to action.

credit.description: Text to be used to credit the teaser source.

credit_url.description: URL to be used to link to the teaser source.

target_ref.description: A reference to the target teaserable node this teaser is bound to.

sync_with_target.description: When true this teaser will automatically be updated to match the target it is bound to whenever the target is modified.
